sub_topic: Determining the diameter of a graph.
message_1:
Given a connected graph with 7 vertices and the following edges:

    (1,2), (1,3), (2,4), (3,5), (4,6), (5,6), (6,7)

What is the diameter of the graph?
message_2:
The diameter of a graph is the longest shortest path between any two vertices in the graph. To find the diameter, we can calculate the shortest paths between all pairs of vertices and find the longest one among them.

Here are the shortest paths between all pairs of vertices:

1-7: 1-2-4-6-7 (length 4)
1-6: 1-2-4-6 (length 3)
1-5: 1-3-5 (length 2)
1-4: 1-2-4 (length 2)
1-3: 1-3 (length 1)
1-2: 1-2 (length 1)

2-7: 2-4-6-7 (length 3)
2-6: 2-4-6 (length 2)
2-5: 2-4-6-5 (length 3)
2-3: 2-1-3 (length 2)

3-7: 3-5-6-7 (length 3)
3-6: 3-5-6 (length 2)
3-4: 3-1-2-4 (length 3)

4-7: 4-6-7 (length 2)
4-5: 4-6-5 (length 2)

5-7: 5-6-7 (length 2)

The longest shortest path is 1-7 with a length of 4. Therefore, the diameter of the graph is 4.
